chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (3 or More 1st Degree Acts)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Millard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A Millard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Michael A Millard was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael A Millard is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Michael A Millard was found guilty of Repeated 1st Deg. Sex.Assault-Same Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(a).
  • Michael A Millard was found guilty of Repeated 1st Deg. Sex.Assault-Same Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  No DNA surcharge ordered.  DNA has already been submitted.  Pay the costs of supervision.

Obtain and maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by your agent.  Not to voluntarily terminate employment without agent's prior approval.  

Obtain housing that meets with agent's approval.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known drug dealers or any known drug users or their residences.  

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other means, with the victim, the victim's mother or their residences.  No unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Must register as a lifetime sexual offender and undergo a sex offender assessment and comply with all recommendations.  

Obey all rules and conditions established by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with risk and needs assessment and any other screening tools identified by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with case plan goals related to identified criminogenic needs and follow through with all programming recommended by the Department of Corrections.  Successfully completed the Department of Corrections' CGIP program.  Undergo anger management counseling and comply with any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: same as prison sentence.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Covey.  All parties have reviewed the PSI.  Victim's mother wants to speak.  State recommends 45 years each count, concurrent.  30 years IC.  15 years ES.  Consecutive to sentences now serving.  C.S., victim's mother spoke to the court.  Defense makes sentencing argument.  Recommends 10 years IC.  5 years ES.  Concurrent to each other.  Consecutive to the sentence he is now serving.  Sex offender registration.  Sex offender treatment and any other treatment his agent recommends.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court orders: Total 40 years.  25 IC,  15 yrs ES.  Each count.  Concurrent.  Consecutive to sentence now serving.  No CIP or SAP.   Credit for 226 days.  ES conditions:  Sex offender assmt & comply with rec trtmt.  Register as a sex offender for the rest of his life.  No contact with victim or victim's mother or their residence.  Obey rules of agent.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.     Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact with any females under the age of 18.   O/M employment, in occupation acceptable to agent.  Obtain housing that meets with his agent's approval.  AODA.  Successfully complete CGIP program.  Anger management counseling and rec treatment.  No DNA surcharge.  CC.

Motion to Prohibit defendant's Probation Agent from Drafting PSI

Covers case No. 14CF72 and 14CF60.  If released, must be equipped with GPS monitoring devise.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with the victims in 14CF60 and 14CF72.    Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin, Jackson or Clark County.  Must remain at parents home, except for legal and medical appointments.

DKJ clerked.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Covey.  State moved to revoke defendant's cash bond or increase it.  ADA asked for $500,000. cash w/GPS monitoring and further conditions.  Defense argued against raising the bond, no objection to GPS monitoring and the other requested conditions.   Court ordered the bond be amended. Attorney Covey's Motion to Prohibit defendant's Probation Agent from Drafting PSI heard. Court advised that the defense may obtain an alternate PSI if they desire.  Attorney Covey will draft order denying that motion.  Defendant was remanded to the Jackson County jail.  Judge ordered $20,000 bond previously posted can be refunded to poster if not posting additional cash bond amount.
State's Motion to Revoke Bond or Increase Cash Bond.

Covers Case No. 14CF60 and 14CF72.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  A.A.K.
Excerpt of jury trial, C.S. testimony.
3 - Medical records
#2 - diagram of house
1 - DVD of victim's interview.  Cannot be scanned.
Exhibits 1 - 3 listed
Not guilty of Count 3 in Information
Guilty of Count 2 in Information
Guilty of Count 1 in Information
Preliminary
Jury panel questions during deliberation

Defendant appears in custody with counsel Michael Covey.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  On record at 8:17 with jury present.  State calls witness #1, K.B., sworn and testifies.  State calls witness #2, J.P., sworn and testifies.  Exhibits 1 & 2 offerred by State and received.  State calls witness #3.  Defense calls witness #1, D.M., sworn and testifies.  Defense calls witness #2, W.M, sworn and testifies.  Break for lunch at 10:55 and back on record at 12:46.  State calls last witness, R.B., sworn and testifes.  State offers Exhibit #3 and is received.  State rests.  Court performs right to testify colloquey with defendant.  Defendant wishes to testify.  Court finds he knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily makes his decision to testify.  Jury out at 1:56 to work on jury instructions.  Jury back in at 2:46.  Judge reads jury instructions.  Closing arguments at 3:04 and are completed at 4:23.  Court reads final jury instructions.  Jury out to deliberate at 4:32.  Jury back in at 5:50 with 2 questions.  Judge answers questions in writing back to jury.  Jury has verdict at 8:52.  Finding of guilty to Count 1 in Information; guilty to Count 2 in Information; and not guilty to Count 3 in Information.  State moves to enter finding.  Court enters findings on Counts 1 & 2 and dismisses Count 3.  PSI is ordered with due date at least 10 days prior to sentencing date.  Sentencing will be scheduled with J.A.  14CF72 will also be scheduled.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Covey.  Held in chambers.  Discussion held on victim's testimony.  Audio recording allowed, not in it's entirety.  Motion in liminie, defense #12.  Granted, excluded.  Vior Dire process discussed.

Defendant present in custody with counsel Michael Covey.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court asks on record if all panel members have been given the voir dire oath.  Clerk answers yes.  Voir dire begins at 9:00 with strikes beginning at 10:35.  Jury selected by 10:43.  Clerk swears in selected panel.  Court takes 15 minute break.  Resume at 11:01 with jury still out of courtroom.  Some discussion by counsel and Judge regarding sidebars.  Jury back in at 11:03 and instructions begin.  Opening arguments begin at 11:14 and end at 11:40.  State calls 1st witness, C.S., sworn and testifies.  Jury out and brea for lunch at 12:25.  Resume at 1:27.  State calls witness #2, L.L., sworn and testifies.  With witness on the stand, DA plays video of recorded interview of victim.  State calls witness #3, H.S., sworn and testifies.  Jury excused for day at 4:09.  Judge addresses an issue brought up during trial.  Adjourn for day at 4:20.
Amended Discovery Notice.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on K.I., D.O. to appear at the jury trial on May 19-21, 2015
Per Mary Miller - FPT on 8-26-15 and JT starting 9-16-15 can be taken off calendar.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on H. N. S. to appear at JT
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on C. S. to appear at JT
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Det. J.P. to appear at JT
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on SW L.O. to appear at JT

Final Pre-trial on 14CF60:  Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Michael Covey.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense confirms that the Demand for Discover and Inspection filed in September has been complied with except regarding the expert witness.  DA Inlow states they haven't received any documents but have witness list.  Attorney Covey states there is no new evidence but he may have a couple of civil witnesses (defendant's parents) that may testify and he objects to request to file a written summary of testimony.  DA Inlow states there is no need to file the summary.  Court orders:  #1 - will reserve finding as the Court first wants to watch the entire video testimony; granted exclusion for victim to be present during trial; Grants exclusion for witness to be present during trial but will re-visit witness issues regarding period of incarceration; Court will reserve ruling on #12; Court will allow recorded testimony to be played; DA is to supply all information to defense regarding testimony of witness within 10 days prior to trial date.  14CF72 is backup trial.

Defendant appeared with counsel Michael Covery.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  14CF60 is to be set for a 3-day jury trial and FPT.  14CF70 is a backup to that trial but will also be set for trial at a later date.  Bond continued.
